value: http://www.les-plus-beaux-villages-de-france.org/en/eguisheim Les Plus Beaux Villages de France
One of the circular residential streets

A distinctive feature of Eguisheim is that the town is shaped roughly as a circle with 3 circular streets, one outside the town centre and 2 within. On the circular Rue du Rampart, the houses are built into the old town ramparts. The circular residential streets within the ramparts are very quaint and photogenic. There are many decorative floral displays throughout town. 

Eguisheim is the supposed bithplace of Bruno d'Eguisheim-Dagsbourg (1002-1054), a former bishop of
, who became Pope Léon IX. You can see his statue in Place du Château in the centre of town.

value: ) "Sainte Croix en Plaine / Herrlisheim", direction Eguisheim

This round, medieval town is about 250 meters in diameter. It's quite walkable.

value: Place du Château: Here you will see the statue of Pope Léon IX. The fountain in the square was built between 1834 and 1836, and is one of the largest in Alsace.
Rues des Remparts: The concentric streets have houses built since the mid 16th century against the ramparts.
